quest.name: A Brother's Grief
journal: Y'shtola is appraising the voidgate with a scholarly eye.
objectives: Speak with Varshahn at the High Crucible of Al-Kimiya.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Perhaps I might linger a touch longer...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Even in the learned halls of Sharlayan, 'tis forbidden to throw wide the gates to the abyss. The peril is far too great...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Can such a tiny portal truly be so dangerous?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I expect you have more questions...

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: My boat is at your disposal!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed to Weaver's Warding?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: The Thirteenth... What chaos must consume that world...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Vrtra's grief for a lost sibling will be no mystery to Estinien. His hath been a life entwined with sorrow, even before he became host to Nidhogg's essence.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I wondered how one of the first brood could simply vanish and leave no trace of her passage. Now I have my answer.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Millennia have passed since last I saw her. But I see Azdaja in memory still, clear and vivid...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: So they managed not only to expand the fissure, but also manipulate it as one might a gate...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Astonishing. Is there any chance I could learn more of how this feat was accomplished?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I will tell you what I can. First, however, I must return to the High Crucible, and arrange to replace the guardians you so handily destroyed. It will not do to leave the gate undefended.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Ah, my apologies─we were perhaps a touch zealous in our rush to uncover the vault's secrets. If the constructs can be repaired, we would be happy to offer our assistance...?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: That will not be necessary. Much as I retain spare vessels for myself, we keep duplicate guardians on hand for such eventualities. In any case, we should return to Radz–at–Han.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: While I am loath to keep Krile waiting much longer, I cannot bring myself to leave before hearing more of Vrtra's tale...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Twas a most enjoyable expedition, for which I am grateful. As for mine evaluation, I shall impress upon the Loporrits that a treasure vault is incomplete without daunting sentinels to test the mettle of any would-be intruders.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Vrtra speaks as if Azdaja is a lost cause. But I wager he feels differently in his heart of hearts.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: There is much about the voidgate that I cannot even begin to explain. I must convince Vrtra to share everything he knows...

dialogue.name: ALCHEMIST04530
dialogue.text: This is quite the gathering. To what do we owe the pleasure...?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I promise we will discuss the voidgate further, but first I must attend to the matter of the vault's sentinels.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: As your instruments have no doubt informed you, the Kapikulu has been reduced to so much scrap. Please bring a new one out of storage, and see that it is conveyed to its post along with some few lesser constructs.

dialogue.name: ALCHEMIST04530
dialogue.text: Was it tomb robbers? Fiends born of the Tower of Zot? By the Sisters, do not tell me a blasphemy yet roams free!

dialogue.name: ALCHEMIST04530
dialogue.text: Why such guilty faces!? Surely it isn't you who are responsible for this... Oh.

dialogue.name: ALCHEMIST04530
dialogue.text: Ahem, well...the details aren't important! I shall see it done immediately.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: And with that, the vault will soon be secure once more. Now, I believe you had questions?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Quite a few, in fact. But I'd like to begin with the gate itself. It is still functional, yes?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Indeed, which is why I saw it sealed with an alchemically forged lock and warded it with my magicks. Such power must not fall into the wrong hands.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: In truth, the primary reason for the vault's construction was to keep the gate hidden from the outside world.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: So much effort for such a little door.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: That “little door” you speak of leads to an abyss teeming with unspeakable horrors.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: That said, in its current state, it would admit only the lowliest of voidsent. And from this side, no man would be able to pass through.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: No man? I should think Alphinaud would fit, given a firm enough push.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Physical size is only one consideration. The true restriction hinges upon the aetheric density of the soul in transit.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And yet you succeeded in expanding this diminutive portal and sending your simulacrum to the Thirteenth...

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Thanks to my brilliant alchemists. I should have destroyed the anomaly when I found it, but instead, I bade them devise a means to control it.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: After much experimentation, they accomplished the impossible. A method was conceived by which my magicks could manipulate the fissure and transform it into a serviceable gate.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: But the process has long since been forgotten. Once I had given up searching for Azdaja, there was no need to preserve such esoteric and dangerous knowledge.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Thus has the gate lain dormant, for years uncounted.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Our own passage to the Thirteenth was made relatively simple thanks to the Crystal Tower.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: An ancient mechanism channeled the tower's vast stores of energy to open a voidgate─one bound to a covenant made with the Cloud of Darkness.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Once that sovereign entity was beaten back, however, the covenant was broken, and the doorway severed from its connection to the void.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Theoretically, it should be possible to reconnect the gate by forging a new pact with another voidsent...but such deals usually end in betrayal and death.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: You seem to have struck a bargain of your own, Forename. Though it serves you well in battle, be aware that the beneficial nature of your “arrangement” is the exception which proves the rule.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: In any case, we should attempt to gain an understanding of the Bounty gate. Mayhap you could resume the search for your sister...

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: As I have already explained, I put those futile hopes to rest centuries ago. My place─and my duty─is here now.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Ah, I had meant to ask... What prompted you to search for the vault in the first place?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: To see if the legends were true.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It was all Estinien's idea.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: As you have seen, the “fabulous wealth” from the stories is quite real, if not its rumored origin. But I'm afraid I must assert a prior claim.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I've been adding to that trove for years, little by little. But the time has come to spend it, that I might alleviate my people's suffering.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: As I recall, 'twas you who was chasing tales of undersea ruins.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Well, as you have seen, the “fabulous wealth” from the stories is quite real, if not its rumored origin. But I'm afraid I must assert a prior claim.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I've been adding to that trove for years, little by little. But the time has come to spend it, that I might alleviate my people's suffering.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Then we are of one mind. We had no intention of taking it for ourselves.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Isn't that right, my friend?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Your Excellency. Would you object if I were to conduct a closer examination of the gate? I will make no attempt to open it, of course.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I owe you and yours a debt that can never be repaid. Whatever boon you ask of me, you shall have it.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: You are most gracious. I shall take full advantage of your permission.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Would that I could join thee in thy study, but the Loporrits will be anxious to receive my report. I beg my leave of you.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: And I must be off to Sharlayan, as well.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Mistress Krile was eager to speak with you about that request, so please come back to the annex as soon as you are able. Farewell for now!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We can discuss my findings once I return. You'll not be rid of me so easily.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may now undertake the Chronicles of a New Era quest series “Myths of the Realm.” Speak with the fresh-faced Student at the Baldesion Annex to accept the first quest.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I hope you enjoyed the expedition, at least. Otherwise it was a heavy purse to pay for a treasure map leading to a treasure we couldn't keep.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: The difficult part in all this will be deciding how best to put these riches to use...

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Will you lend me your assistance in these deliberations?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Of course.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Anything to make up for the constructs we broke...

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Then think of your employment as recompense. Serve me as guest advisors, and I will consider the broken constructs paid for in full.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Forename and I are in this together. I will follow herhis example.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, elsewhere...

dialogue.name: EARTHMONOLITH
dialogue.text: (-Throne of Earth-)I sssensed the breaching of a gate, but it was not inssstigated from this ssside. 'Twas thrown open from the other...

dialogue.name: FIREMONOLITH
dialogue.text: (-Throne of Fire-)I, too, felt it. A rare occurrence, yes, but such a tiny portal is beneath our notice. There are more pressing matters at hand.

dialogue.name: FIREMONOLITH
dialogue.text: (-Throne of Fire-)An opportunity is upon us, the coming of which we have awaited for nigh on ten thousand years. We dare not let it slip our grasp.

dialogue.name: WINDMONOLITH
dialogue.text: (-Throne of Wind-)Yet we must not underestimate shehe who bested the Cloud of Darkness. Even restrained by a covenant, the Cloud was no feeble wisp to be dispersed by some flesh-and-blood mortal.

dialogue.name: WATERMONOLITH
dialogue.text: (-Throne of Water-)Bah, let herhim come! I will drown the world and watch this fleshling gasp for breath in herhis final moments!

dialogue.name: BLACKKNIGHT
dialogue.text: (-Knight in Black-)Your zeal is admirable, but forget not our cause.

dialogue.name: BLACKKNIGHT
dialogue.text: (-Knight in Black-)Think back on our struggles beneath this sunless sky. Remember why we cede not our will to fight.

dialogue.name: BLACKKNIGHT
dialogue.text: (-Knight in Black-)'Tis time we set the war in motion, and win redemption for our star!
